description: Scientific thought before the modern era.

slides.title: Origins of Science
slides.content:
# Observing Nature üëÅÔ∏è

Ancient humans needed to understand nature for survival.
- **Agriculture**: Needed calendars for planting (Astronomy).
- **Medicine**: Treating wounds and illness.
- **Engineering**: Building pyramids and ziggurats.

slides.title: Mesopotamia and Egypt
slides.content:
# The Cradle üèõÔ∏è

- **Babylonians**: Advanced math (Base 60 system - why we have 60 seconds).
- **Egyptians**: Geometry for surveying land after Nile floods. Anatomy from mummification.

slides.title: Greek Natural Philosophy
slides.content:
# The Thinkers üí≠

Greeks tried to explain nature without gods/myths.
- **Thales**: Water is the fundamental substance.
- **Democritus**: Proposed "Atomos" (Uncuttable particles).
- **Pythagoras**: Mathematics is the language of nature.

slides.title: Aristotle
slides.content:
# The Master üéì

Wrote about everything (Biology, Physics, Logic).
- Believed Earth was center of universe (Geocentric).
- Believed matter made of 4 elements: Earth, Air, Fire, Water.
- His ideas ruled for 2000 years (even the wrong ones).

slides.title: Ancient Astronomy
slides.content:
# Star Gazers ‚ú®

- **Eratosthenes**: Calculated circumference of Earth using shadows (Very accurate!).
- **Ptolemy**: Formalized the Geocentric Model (Earth-centered). Used complex "epicycles" to explain backward motion of planets.

slides.title: Astronomy Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which ancient model placed Earth at the center of the universe?

slides.title: Ancient Medicine
slides.content:
# Hippocrates ‚öïÔ∏è

"Father of Medicine".
- Separated medicine from religion (sickness is not divine punishment).
- **Hippocratic Oath**: "First, do no harm."
- Humorism: Health is balance of 4 fluids (Blood, Phlegm, Yellow Bile, Black Bile).

slides.title: Archimedes
slides.content:
# Eureka! üõÅ

Greatest mathematician of antiquity.
- **Buoyancy**: Principle of floating.
- **Levers**: "Give me a place to stand and I will move the Earth."
- **War Machines**: Claw, Death Ray (Mirrors).

slides.title: Chinese Science
slides.content:
# The East üèÆ

Independent discoveries.
- **Compass**: For feng shui, then navigation.
- **Gunpowder**: For fireworks, then war.
- **Paper & Printing**: Before Gutenberg.
- **Seismoscope**: Dragon jar detecting earthquakes.

slides.title: Indian Science
slides.content:
# The Zero 0Ô∏è‚É£

- **Mathematics**: Invention of Zero and Decimal system.
- **Ayurveda**: Traditional holistic medicine.
- **Metallurgy**: Rust-free iron pillars.

slides.title: Euclid
slides.content:
# Geometry üìê

Wrote "The Elements".
- Systemized geometry.
- Used proofs and axioms.
- Still used as the textbook for 2000 years.

slides.title: Alchemy Origins
slides.content:
# Proto-Chemistry ‚öóÔ∏è

Quest to turn lead into gold (Transmutation) and find Elixir of Life.
- Egypt/China/Greece.
- Failed at magic, but invented distillation, glassware, and acids.

slides.title: Roman Engineering
slides.content:
# Builders üß±

More practical than theoretical Greeks.
- **Aqueducts**: Moving water miles.
- **Concrete**: Waterproof and durable (Pantheon still stands).
- **Roads**: "All roads lead to Rome".

slides.title: Math Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which civilization is credited with inventing the concept of Zero?

slides.title: The Library of Alexandria
slides.content:
# Knowledge Hub üìö

Massive collection of scrolls in Egypt.
- Center of learning.
- Burned down (multiple times).
- Symbol of lost knowledge.

slides.title: Galen
slides.content:
# Anatomy üíÄ

Roman physician.
- Dissected animals (monkeys/pigs) to understand humans.
- Made mistakes (thought liver pumped blood), but dominated medicine for 1300 years.

slides.title: Mayan Astronomy
slides.content:
# Timekeepers üóìÔ∏è

- Extremely accurate calendars.
- Tracked Venus perfectly.
- Concept of Zero (independently).

slides.title: Loss of Knowledge
slides.content:
# Dark Ages? üåë

Fall of Rome led to loss of texts in Europe.
- Knowledge moved East (Byzantine and Islamic Empires).
- Monasteries kept some books alive.

slides.title: Ancient Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Science began as observation.
- **Greeks** asked "Why?".
- **Romans** asked "How?".
- Foundations of Math and Astronomy were laid.
